panels.description:
Duration of how long a peer was connected

This is mostly informational, but if most of the connections are short lived, you may need to check any reverse proxy or connectivity issues
panels.title: Peer connection duration

panels.description: Number of active connected peers by host
panels.title: Active Peer-Connections per Host

panels.description:
No. of messages forwarded per seconds. 
This doesn't include the failed message count. They are tracked separately.
panels.title: Forwarded messages rate

panels.description: rate of peer Registration and deregistration
panels.title: Registration and deregistration rate

panels.description: time needed to register new peers
panels.title: Peer registration latency

panels.description:
Duration of how long it takes to load a connection from the registry.

NOTE: It should be below 1 ms
panels.title: get_registration request latency

panels.description: Send method is used by peers intending to send a message to another peer. The send covers the RPC call of sending the message from the initiator to signal.
panels.title: RPC requests rate (method: Send)

panels.description: Shows estimated time of how long a peer was connected
panels.title: RPC request latency (method: ConnectStream)
